Tripadvisor’s approach to reviews Before posting, each Tripadvisor review goes through an automated tracking system, which collects information, answering the following questions: how, what, where and when. If the system detects something that potentially contradicts our community guidelines , the review is not published. When the system detects a problem, a review may be automatically rejected, sent to the reviewer for validation, or manually reviewed by our team of content specialists, who work 24/7 to maintain the quality of the reviews on our site. Popular mentions fries oysters live music jds patio beach clearwater Curious429093 1 contribution 0 3 of 5 bubbles NOT the  same Apr 2022 • none Each year I have a group of friends visit from out of town. They always want to go to JD's for their super scallops.   What happened to JD's  delicious huge scallops, these were tiny and tasteless.  We told the  waitress we were disappointed and she stated "yes a lot has changed since Crabby Bills bought us out".  For the price we paid I could have gone to the market  gotten just as "small" cheaper and made them myself.    The only positive they still have music to listen and enjoy during your meal.  I hope that everything isn't changing This used to be a place I would suggest for the best scallops. Read more Written 19 April 2022 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Veronica Ayala Thank you for your review. We are sorry we left you disappointed with our scallops. We work hard to source only the best ingredients and apologize that your scallops did not reach your table as intended. If ever something is not to your liking, please don't hesitate to let your manager know so our team can immediately work to make things right for you.
I would like to look further into this and would appreciate if you would email me at marketing@crabbybills.com with more details about your visit (date/time, who your server was, receipt #, last 4 digits of card used for payment if applicable, if you spoke to the manager, etc.). With more information, we will be better able to address and correct the issues you experienced.
We hope for the opportunity to serve you again and show you the great experience you are used to.
Thank you,
Veronica - Brands Manager Read more Written 20 April 2022 This response is the subjective opinion of the management representative and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Claudia 4 contributions 1 3 of 5 bubbles No precautions utilized for safety of customers Jun 2020 • none I enjoy going to this establishment but since reopening I’m not at all impressed. If your looking for a safe place to dine this is not the place. My experience started by not seeing one employee wearing a mask. It continued when I was given a plastic covered menu that I witnessed being continually used without being cleaned. There were no precautions taken. I asked management why no one was wearing masks and was told employees did not want to wear them. 
So there you go. Dine there at your own risk. Read more Written 7 June 2020 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Gigi152 Tampa 41 contributions 0 2 of 5 bubbles Not What It Used to Be May 2024 • couples The food in this place has really gone downhill since it was bought by the Crabby Bill's organization. It used to be a place to get a pretty good meal, but what we have been served lately is an insult. A single dried-up and wilted piece of lettuce slapped on a plate, way overcooked and dried out fish, a tiny and burnt baked potato, and that was probably the best of the meals at our table. The service too used to be stellar. But they got rid of the more experienced staff and hired clearly inexperienced staff to presumably pay less. The drinks used to be reasonably priced. Now they are priced much higher, and the quality of what you get is rock bottom. The music is still great. But that is the only thing that is reminiscent of the old JDs. There are better places on the beach. We won't be back. Read more Written 18 May 2024 This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more. Crabby Bill's Family Brands Gigi152, we are so sorry to hear we left you disappointed. We strive to provide our guests with excellent service and delicious food. We apologize if we did not accomplish our goals during your visit and I would greatly appreciate additional information so I can look further into this. Please email me directly at mackenzie.baird@bigclawmanagement.com with these and more details (date/time of visit, receipt #, server's name, last 4 digits of credit card if applicable, if you spoke to a manager, etc.) With more information, I can better address and correct the issues you experienced. We hope to make things right and show you a much better experience. Candice C 1 contribution 1 2 of 5 bubbles Food runner was a delight. Waitress was awful. Nov 2023 • family This is my first time at JDs, I was excited to get breakfast here with my family until i got Here! Our waitress T was visibly flustered and annoyed by our being there. She was rude from the moment we sat down. She never introduced herself or anything we had to ask her what her name was at the end of our meal.. She claimed it was because she was soo busy so she couldn’t be bothered with seeing if we needed silverware or coffee. She got to taking our order and because she was speaking so fast i misunderstood what she said and she gave me a dirty cocky look for not hearing her correctly. My grandfather asked her if she was going to give him anymore coffee and she said oh sure i have 10 tables It’s busy make sure you catch me when you can for coffee. The guy who brought out our food was a delight. He was so welcoming and made us feel happy to eat. Wish i could say the same for her. Probably won’t be back due to her making us feel unwelcome. Kim Hartford 2 contributions 3 1 of 5 bubbles Bring Your Wallet and Patience Jun 2021 • family So we are on Vacation from KY.  We decided to try JDs because it was about the only place we called with no wait.  (There's a reason)  so...my group was my husband, 21 year old daughter, and sons 17, 15, and 12. My daughter went in first and the hostess told her to sit at the tables by the door because she didn't have time to seat us right now.  Many tables were visibly open.  
We sat for 25 to 30 min.  The waitress took our order after we were seated and didn't take my sons order before she walked off.  I flagged her down and she acted like I aggravated her.  We ordered our food...my youngest got a cheeseburger and my daughter and 15 year old shared a meal of crablegs.   We got an appetizer and 4 of us ordered water to drink.  When we were finished we got the bill...175.00!  30.00 tip included.  When I asked about that I was told that any party of 5 or more automatically got it added.  They were my children!  Not a party of 5 different tickets that makes it more challenging.  The food was good but very small portions.  Very overpriced.  Bad service..  Would NOT return.  If I tip someone I want to choose the amount.  I dont want to tip someone 30.00 for poor/mediocre service. The single female bartender was snippy and could have used some help,  unless you were one of her regulars. All of our food orders were delivered  hot, flavorful and together. Outdoor bar had live music and a dance area. Seafood is fresh and well prepared. Salads were also crisp. Good place to stop, but come early, gets crowded. Michelle008_800 Tavistock 177 contributions 0 5 of 5 bubbles Good Food Jan 2020 • couples My husband and I ate here while on vacation in the area. We saw the menu online and had to check it out. They have an early bird menu for $9.25 if you order before 6pm. I ordered the chicken and my husband had the all you can eat fish and chips for $9.95. They also had happy hour draft beers for $1.25. The food was good. They have a back room with live bands playing and it was packed. People were dancing and having a great time back there. The waiters were very friendly and the service was fast. Betsy A Charleston 131 contributions 0 5 of 5 bubbles Loved it Jul 2021 • none This is an older place and a little like stepping back to the 70s or 80s. We were immediately greeted by hostess and given option of self seating outside or a small wait for inside. We chose outside and glad we did as the band was excellent and we were able to eat dinner out there. People were dancing and having a good time. Inside is quiet dining room. Sheree was our waitress and she was great. She had lots of personality, was attentive and fun. Our service was excellent even on this very busy night. The outside was packed and full. The food did not disappoint. We had peel and eat shrimp, Chicago oysters, salad, gumbo. Crab legs and bacon wrapped scallops. All were very,  very good with very reasonable prices compared to others in the area. We would definitely go back. This was one of our best meals on our trip and Sheree and the delicious, fresh food made it extra nice. Loved seeing everyone having so much fun. Home Menu Drinks Specials Catering About Us Events Jobs Rewards Contact Us Menu Home Menu Drinks Specials Catering About Us Events Jobs Rewards Contact Us Gift Cards Gift Cards About Monstah Lobstah Monstah Lobstah ABOUT US Welcome to Monstah Lobstah, your ultimate destination for fresh, Northeastern-inspired seafood right here in the heart of Indian Rocks Beach. Our mission is to bring the authentic taste and charm of New England to Florida’s Gulf Coast. Monstah Lobstah proudly features fresh live Maine lobsters, a wide variety of fresh seafood, and a menu crafted to delight seafood lovers and families alike. With a focus on quality and value, we offer a dining experience where everyone can enjoy premium meals without breaking the bank. Set in a clean and inviting atmosphere, Monstah Lobstah celebrates the spirit of the sea while paying homage to the beloved local landmark, JD’s, which previously called this location home. We’ve kept the sense of community alive, infusing our space with both nostalgia and fresh energy. Enjoy live music on our back porch daily, adding a lively and welcoming vibe to every visit. Whether you’re looking to enjoy a family night out, a date with unbeatable seafood, or a casual gathering with friends, Monstah Lobstah is the place to be. Come for the lobstah, stay for the memories. We look forward to serving you! The team that has contributed to over 3 decades, as well as the numerous guests over the years is a testament to the success of their hard work and spirit. Monstah Lobstah offers a taste of New England | Dining Out goguide Kats! Dining Out top 100 restaurants Faves & Craves Outdoors Bars Nightlife Music Arts & Culture Free Family Friendly lvrj.com subscribe manage activate sign in sign out 5359822-0-4 Home >> Dining Out Dining Out Monstah Lobstah offers a taste of New England March 2, 2011 - 2:06 am That's right: It's called Monstah Lobstah, the name crafted to suggest both the speech and the quintessential entree of New England. Monstah Lobstah New England Seafood Restaurant comes to Southern Nevada by way of Tampa, Fla., and currently operates restaurants inside two Doc Holliday's Saloons here. The first, at 2551 Anthem Village Drive, Henderson, opened in mid-October. A month later, the second area Monstah Lobstah opened at 9310 S. Eastern Ave., Henderson. Carol Pritchard, restaurant manager for both locations, said Monstah Lobstah -- the chain is owned and operated by mixed martial arts fighter Allen Berube, whose occasional nickname is "Monstah" -- offers a figurative and literal taste of New England in family-friendly surroundings. Some dishes even are served in cups and paper boats of the sort you'd see back in New England, Pritchard said. "People come in from New England and say, 'This reminds me of the restaurant I used to go to back home.' " The menu includes such Maine classics as lobsters and New England-style belly clams (both market price) and "Lobstah" rolls ($7.99). Early risers can order a lobster omelet ($9.99) off the breakfast menu, while a selection of kids' meals ($3.99 each) are built around such favorites as mac and cheese, corn dogs and fish and chicken strips. For diners whose tastes don't lean toward seafood, Monstah Lobstah offers such land-bred entrees as a hand-cut 10-ounce New York strip steak ($15.99) The Anthem location seats about 80 and the South Eastern Avenue location about 120. Reservations are accepted for groups of six or more. Both locations are open from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. Sundays through Thursdays and 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays. Starters: Crab cakes, $7.99; peel-and-eat shrimp, $7.99 for a half-pound; mussels simmered in the shell, $9.99 Soups and salads: New England-style seafood chowder, $4.99 a cup or $6.99 a bowl; Caesar salad, $5.99 (add chicken breast for $3 or lobster meat for $8); "Lobstah salad," $11.99 Entrees: Haddock fish fry, $11.99; the "Samplah" (haddock, shrimp, scallops, hush puppies and fries), $18.99; crab ($13.99) or lobster ($16.99) macaroni and cheese Desserts: Chocolate or carrot cake ($5.99) Information: 399-1200 (South Eastern Avenue) or 671-4194 (Anthem Village Drive). -- By John Przybys most read Sponsored By One Nevada Credit Union LISTEN TO THE TOP FIVE HERE in case you missed it THE TOP 100 RESTAURANTS IN LAS VEGAS From Strip standouts to neighborhood hangouts, here’s our guide to the finest food and drink in Las Vegas READ MORE more Dining Out Portillo’s may not be coming to Las Vegas, after all Top 10 things to do in Las Vegas this week What’s new in food, drink this NFL season at Las Vegas’ Allegiant Stadium 5 tasty varieties of boba tea to try across Las Vegas Vegas food truck known for pasta cones opens 1st restaurant 3 new Hawaiian coffee, lunch spots open in the Las Vegas Valley Longtime Vegas cheesesteak spot closing for refresh A guide to Las Vegas’ full slate of fall festivals Downtown Vegas museum to debut open-air cocktail lounge, event space Top 10 things to do in Las Vegas this week A popular sushi bar closes in downtown Las Vegas.
